articles.author: Paul Esch-Laurent
articles.description:
Mermaid diagrams and flowcharts have been gaining traction, especially with GitHubâ€™s announcement that they are natively supported in Markdown. Letâ€™s take a look at what they are, how to use them, and just as importantly: why.
Just like you â€¦
Making Mermaid Diagrams in Markdown originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Making Mermaid Diagrams in Markdown

articles.author: Shimin Zhang
articles.description:
Iâ€™m a big fan of movies by J.J. Abrams. I enjoy their tight plots, quippy dialog, and of course: anamorphic lens flares. Filmmakers like Abrams use lens flare to add a dash of â€˜homemadeâ€™ realism to their movies, â€¦
Add a CSS Lens Flare to Photos for a Bright Touch originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Add a CSS Lens Flare to Photos for a Bright Touch

articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
Content delivery networks, or CDNs, allow you to improve the delivery of your websiteâ€™s static resources, most notably, with CDN caching. They do this by serving your content from edge locations, which are located all over the world. When a â€¦
Adding CDN Caching to a Vite Build originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
We recently covered creating fancy borders with CSS mask properties, and now we are going to cut the corners with CSS mask and clip-path! A lot of techniques exist to cut different shapes from the corners of any element. â€¦

articles.title: Tricks to Cut Corners Using CSS Mask and Clip-Path Properties

articles.author: Daniel Schwarz
articles.description:
A bookmarklet is a JavaScript-based bookmark that adds to a web browser. Iâ€™d like to show you some awesome web browser hacks to aid your web development workflow and how to convert those hacks into time-saving bookmarklets.
Activating design mode
â€¦
6 Useful Bookmarklets to Boost Web Development originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Jens Oliver Meiert
articles.description:
You may not use XHTML (anymore), but when you write HTML, you may be more influenced by XHTML than you think. You are very likely writing HTML, the XHTML way.
What is the XHTML way of writing HTML, and what â€¦

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lee Munroe)
articles.description: What are the benefits of using push notifications and what can you use them for? In this article, Lee Munroe explains how to implement them and which practices are best to follow.
articles.title: The Ultimate Guide To Push Notifications For Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marli Mesibov)
articles.description: Storytelling is a powerful tool for any UX designer. It helps create a product and understand the people who use it. articles.title: How To Use Storytelling In UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Whether you work in-house or run a digital agency, there are occasions when you will consider hiring freelancers to supplement your team. articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)

articles.title: Designing A Better Carousel UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dan Donald)

articles.title: Boost Resource Loading With fetchpriority, a New Priority Hint

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Poder)
articles.description: Next.jsâ€™ recent 12.0 release included a new beta feature: middleware. articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jarijn Nijkamp)
articles.description: After two years when almost everything moved online, 2022 marks the return of in-person conferences. In fact, [SmashingConf is back](https://smashingconf.com/conferences): coming to  San Francisco and Austin in June, Freiburg (Germany) in September, and New York in October.
